constructs.name: weekend_work_hours
constructs.description: Amount of time spent on work activities during weekend days

constructs.name: unfinished_weekday_tasks
constructs.description: Volume of work tasks not completed during the Monday-Friday work period that carry over

constructs.name: weekday_productivity
constructs.description: Efficiency and output during regular work hours on weekdays

constructs.name: workload_volume
constructs.description: Total amount of work tasks assigned or committed to in a given period

constructs.name: work_stress
constructs.description: Experienced stress, pressure, and anxiety related to work demands

constructs.name: work_rumination
constructs.description: Intrusive, repetitive thoughts about work during non-work time

constructs.name: sleep_quality
constructs.description: Restorative quality of sleep including ease of falling asleep and feeling rested

constructs.name: energy_levels
constructs.description: Physical and mental energy available throughout the day

constructs.name: boundary_enforcement
constructs.description: Active behaviors to separate work from personal time such as turning off notifications or leaving devices at office

constructs.name: weekend_social_commitments
constructs.description: Planned activities with family, friends, or community on weekends

constructs.name: weekend_recovery_activities
constructs.description: Engagement in hobbies, exercise, relaxation, and restorative non-work activities on weekends

constructs.name: planning_quality
constructs.description: How well work tasks are prioritized, scheduled, and organized during the week

constructs.name: physical_activity
constructs.description: Amount of physical exercise and movement during the day

constructs.name: work_guilt
constructs.description: Feelings of guilt or shame about not working or taking personal time

constructs.name: deadline_pressure
constructs.description: Proximity to and urgency of externally-imposed work deadlines

constructs.name: manager_weekend_communication
constructs.description: Whether managers or colleagues send work communications on weekends

constructs.name: job_role_demands
constructs.description: Structural demands of the job role including on-call requirements and client-facing responsibilities

constructs.name: organizational_culture
constructs.description: Workplace norms regarding work hours, availability expectations, and work-life balance values

constructs.name: workaholism_tendency
constructs.description: Trait-level tendency toward compulsive overworking and difficulty disengaging from work

constructs.name: boundary_setting_self_efficacy
constructs.description: Confidence in one's ability to successfully set and maintain work-life boundaries

constructs.name: social_support_availability
constructs.description: Availability of supportive relationships with family, friends, or partners

edges.description: Tasks not completed during the week create pressure to work on weekends to catch up
High work stress creates anxiety that drives compulsive checking and working on weekends
Intrusive work thoughts during weekends make it harder to resist the urge to work
Active boundary behaviors like turning off notifications reduce weekend work
Feeling guilty about not working drives compensatory weekend work behavior
Scheduled activities with others create competing demands that prevent weekend work
Engagement in hobbies and recovery activities provides alternatives to defaulting to work
Higher productivity during work hours means more tasks completed before the weekend
More total work assigned means more likely to have incomplete tasks at week end
Good planning and prioritization enables more focused efficient work
Better sleep enables better cognitive function and focus during work
Higher energy levels enable sustained focus and output during work hours
High stress impairs concentration and cognitive function reducing productivity
Good sleep directly determines daily energy levels
Regular physical activity increases sustained energy throughout the day
Physical activity promotes better more restorative sleep
Work stress causes rumination and physiological arousal that impairs sleep
Thinking about work at night disrupts ability to fall and stay asleep
Higher work stress leads to more intrusive thoughts about work during off-hours
Having incomplete tasks creates ongoing stress and pressure
Approaching deadlines increase experienced stress levels
Higher workload volume increases daily stress levels
Believing you can set boundaries enables actual boundary-setting behaviors
High stress makes it harder to maintain boundaries as anxiety pushes toward checking work
A culture expecting constant availability makes boundary enforcement socially costly
Weekend emails and messages from management directly trigger work responses
Imminent deadlines directly increase weekend work to meet them
Some roles structurally have higher baseline workload
Some roles like on-call positions structurally require weekend availability
Workaholic tendencies lead to more persistent thoughts about work
Workaholism makes it psychologically harder to maintain boundaries
Workaholic tendencies amplify guilt about taking time off
Cultures that valorize overwork increase guilt about not working
Weekend work crowds out time available for recovery activities perpetuating the cycle
Weekend recovery helps restore and improve sleep quality for the coming week
Recovery activities help reduce accumulated work stress
Working weekends perpetuates the stress cycle by preventing proper recovery
Having incomplete work creates guilt that persists into weekends
Having energy makes it more likely to engage in physical exercise
High stress reduces motivation and perceived time available for physical activity
Higher energy enables better executive function for planning and organizing work
Social commitments often involve recovery activities like shared meals or recreation
High stress leads to social withdrawal and canceling weekend plans
Guilt about not working leads to accepting additional tasks and commitments
Having supportive relationships increases likelihood of weekend social plans
Social support provides a buffer against work-related stress
Supportive relationships facilitate engagement in restorative weekend activities

indicators.name: weekend_work_visit
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this is a visit to a work-related website (programming docs, GitHub, Stack Overflow, technical sites) occurring on Saturday or Sunday, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: weekend_work_search
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this is a work-related search (programming, technical topics, professional research) occurring on Saturday or Sunday, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: friday_late_work
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this is work-related browsing occurring after 7pm on Friday, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: weeknight_late_work
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this is work-related browsing occurring after 8pm on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, or Thursday, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: work_during_workhours
indicators.how_to_measure: For activity during weekday work hours (9am-6pm Mon-Fri): 1 if work-related (technical docs, programming, professional research), 0 if non-work. Return null for activities outside these hours or on weekends.

indicators.name: workhour_distraction
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this is non-work browsing (entertainment, social media, personal shopping, news) during weekday work hours (9am-6pm Mon-Fri), 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: weekday_work_activity
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this is work-related browsing (technical searches, documentation, professional research) on a weekday, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: work_domain_category
indicators.how_to_measure: Categorize work activities by domain: 'programming' (code, languages), 'security_crypto' (security, encryption), 'infrastructure' (devops, servers), 'research' (papers, learning), 'other_work', or 'not_work' for non-work activities.

indicators.name: stress_related_search
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this search/visit relates to stress, anxiety, burnout, mental health, therapy resources, or coping strategies, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: physical_symptom_search
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this search relates to stress-related physical symptoms (headaches, muscle tension, stomach issues, fatigue, heart palpitations), 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: after_hours_work
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this is work-related browsing after 7pm on any day, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: late_night_work
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this is work-related browsing after 10pm, indicating strong difficulty disconnecting, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: after_11pm_activity
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if any browsing activity (work or personal) occurs after 11pm, 0 otherwise. Higher values indicate poorer sleep habits.

indicators.name: sleep_problem_search
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this search/visit relates to sleep issues, insomnia, sleep trackers (Oura, sleep apps), sleep aids, or sleep improvement, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: daytime_browsing
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if browsing occurs during active daytime hours (8am-8pm), 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: fatigue_related_search
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this search relates to tiredness, fatigue, low energy, needing caffeine, or energy supplements, 0 otherwise. Presence indicates low energy.

indicators.name: work_before_7pm
indicators.how_to_measure: For work-related activities: 1 if occurring before 7pm, 0 if at or after 7pm. Return null for non-work activities.

indicators.name: post_8pm_work
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this is work-related browsing at or after 8pm, 0 otherwise. Higher values indicate poorer boundary enforcement.

indicators.name: weekend_social_venue_search
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this is a search/visit on Saturday or Sunday for restaurants, bars, cafes, event venues, concerts, or social meetup locations, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: social_event_planning
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this search/visit relates to planning social activities, making reservations, finding event times, or coordinating gatherings, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: weekend_leisure
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this is leisure browsing (entertainment, music, hobbies, sports, movies, travel, gaming) on Saturday or Sunday, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: recreation_search
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this search relates to recreational activities: vacation planning, outdoor activities, hiking, beaches, nature, hobbies, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: planning_tool_search
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this search/visit relates to productivity tools, task managers, calendar apps, to-do lists, or time management techniques, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: deep_work_indicator
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this work activity appears substantive (in-depth documentation reading, tutorial following, thorough research) rather than quick lookups, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: exercise_related_search
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this search/visit relates to exercise, gym, workouts, running, sports, or fitness routines, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: fitness_tracking_search
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this search relates to fitness wearables (Fitbit, Garmin, Oura ring fitness), workout apps, or activity tracking, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: weekend_work_intrusion
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this is work-related browsing on Saturday or Sunday, suggesting guilt-driven work, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: evening_work_intrusion
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this is work-related browsing during evening leisure hours (7pm-10pm) on weekdays, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: urgency_indicator_search
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this search contains urgency terms (deadline, urgent, ASAP, due, rush, emergency, quickly) or relates to urgent troubleshooting, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: error_troubleshooting
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this search/visit relates to debugging, error messages, stack traces, quick fixes, or urgent problem resolution, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: weekend_email_check
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this is a visit to email services (Gmail, Outlook, Yahoo Mail, work email) on Saturday or Sunday, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: weekend_messaging_check
indicators.how_to_measure: Binary: 1 if this is a visit to workplace messaging platforms (Slack, Teams, workplace chat) on Saturday or Sunday, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: incident_monitoring_tool_search
indicators.how_to_measure: Proxy for job_role_demands: Binary: 1 if this search/visit relates to error monitoring, incident tracking, or alerting tools (Sentry, DataDog, PagerDuty, OpsGenie, New Relic, error tracking, incident management), 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: devops_infrastructure_search
indicators.how_to_measure: Proxy for job_role_demands: Binary: 1 if this search/visit relates to DevOps, infrastructure management, server administration, deployment pipelines, or cloud operations (often indicating on-call responsibilities), 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: early_weekend_morning_work
indicators.how_to_measure: Proxy for workaholism_tendency: Binary: 1 if this is work-related browsing before 9am on Saturday or Sunday, indicating compulsive early engagement with work on rest days, 0 otherwise.

indicators.name: burnout_overwork_search
indicators.how_to_measure: Proxy for workaholism_tendency: Binary: 1 if this search relates to burnout, workaholism, overwork, work addiction, or mental health issues linked to excessive work (depression treatments, ketamine for depression while showing work stress patterns), 0 otherwise.
